item.title: Stop, Drop and Pray
item.description: Message - Sunday, May20, 2012. Pastor Gary shares a message that is very close to his heart entitled "Stop, Drop and Pray." The theme was "Desperate Prayer," especially as it’s portrayed in the life of the prophet Daniel. A resource he shared with the congregation was www.OneCry.com. This website has the video clip used in the service along with many other helpful resources.

item.title: A World Without Easter
item.description: Message - Sunday, April 08, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "A World Without Easter." In it, he shares what it would be like if Easter wasn't all about Christ dieing on the cross to save us from our sins. This world would truly be a dark place without the light that He provides.

item.title: It Was No Mistake
item.description: Message - Sunday, April 01, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "It Was No Mistake." When Jesus rode into Jerusalem on that first Palm Sunday, He did so with his eyes wide open, he knew what awaited him there- but He did it for you!

item.title: Get Your Mind Right
item.description: Message - Sunday, January 29, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "Get Your Mind Right." In this sermon, he shared about getting rid of those strongholds that seem to hold us back in our relationships with our Loving Savior. He shared with us some indisputable truths from II Corinthians 10:3-5 about how we can find release from whatever it is holding us back individually.
item.itunes:subtitle: Get Your Mind Right
item.itunes:summary: Message - Sunday, January 29, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "Get Your Mind Right." item.title: Sanctity of Human Life Sunday - Denial
item.description: Message - Sunday, January 22, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "Denial" and speaks on the subject of the Sanctity of Human Life. In the message, he shares with us that it is our Christian responsibility to take an active stand for the lives of all God's creatures, and that includes the lives of the unborn. He challenged us to get involved and really start making changes!
item.itunes:subtitle: Sanctity of Human Life Sunday - Denial

item.itunes:keywords: Hope, Missionary, Church, Bluffton, Indiana, Message

item.title: I Will Build My Church
item.description: Message - Sunday, January 15, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "I Will Build My Church." In this message, he speaks on how Jesus was constantly asking people to go further and witness to more people to bring them into the Kingdom of God. Pastor Gary tied this to the Satellite Campus we are getting ready to launch very soon and how that endeavor is part of expanding Christ's church.
item.itunes:subtitle: I Will Build My Church

item.title: The Heart of Worship
item.description: Message - Sunday, January 08, 2012 Pastor Gary Aupperle shares a sermon entitled "The Heart of Worship." In it, he shares what is his, and should be our, passion for worship. True worship is between you and God. It is not for your benefit, but for God's. It is a way to draw near to our Lord and Savior and tell him how much we love Him!

item.title: Thirty Days of Prayer for the Harvest 4 - Go Rock Your World
item.description: Message - Sunday, October 30, 2011. Pastor Gary Aupperle shares the series entitled "Thirty Days of Prayer for the Harvest." This Sermon Series based on Mt.9:35-38 challenges us to open our eyes to the ripened Harvest Fields and to be the witnesses, both in our own Jerusalem and around the world, that Christ has called us to be.

item.title: What's Up With the Dudes at The Door 10 - Can't We All Just Get Along?
item.description: Message - Sunday, September 04, 2011. Pastor Gary Aupperle shares from his new series, "What’s Up with the Dudes at the Door?" A study of the false cults that have become so prevalent in our day and our Christian response to them; but most importantly we’ll be focusing on the truth of Biblical doctrines that are central to our faith.

item.title: Guest Speaker - Jeremy Rodgers
item.description: Message - Sunday, June 12, 2011. Jeremy Rodgers shares with the congregation about 3 different kinds of "roads" we can take. His caution, which is the title of his sermon, is to Stay off the Paved Road. He shares how the dips, crevices, and potholes are what shape us as Christians and can be a defining factor in our lives and how we use them for Christ.

item.title: Wounded 6 - Help, I Need Somebody
item.description: Message - Sunday, June 5, 2011. Pastor Gary Aupperle concludes the series entitled Wounded. On any given Sunday there are hurting people walking through our doors- people who come from failed marriages, dysfunctional families, painful backgrounds, difficult circumstances; they’re looking for warmth, acceptance, support and love- God intended for His church to be that kind of healing community.
